issue.title: Cleanup the `play.utils` package

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
`play.utils` contains miscellaneous code, in some cases [Â¿even obsolete?](https://github.com/playframework/playframework/blob/6e9431e7ab1d6ad3e79e3baac625207a55560dd8/core/play/src/main/scala/play/utils/Conversions.scala#L12).



In response to the request in https://github.com/playframework/playframework/issues/9745, `Configuration` could be moved out to a one-class artifact. And, similarly, some of the contents of `play.utils` could be pushed up and out of the default `play` artifact to ease their reuse (e.g. `play.util.Colors` being [copy/pasted](https://github.com/lagom/lagom/blob/50ecfbf2e0d51fe24fdf6ad71157e1dff97106b9/dev/build-tool-support/src/main/scala/com/lightbend/lagom/dev/ConsoleHelper.scala#L91) in Lagom to avoid depending in all `play`).

body: Hi, I can work on this, how this separation process is being handled? should I create a new repository and transfer it to you when the work is done, or you provide an empty repo and I submit a pr to it

Hey @gurkankaymak,

You won't need to isolate this in another repository. It should be enough to have a new sbt sub-project (that will then produce a new artifact) and move the code there.

issue.title: separated Configuration class from core as a sbt sub-project

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
closes #9745 

also created the `Play-Utils` sub project for the dependencies of Configuration class

issue.title: Seperate config

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
<!--- Copyright (C) from 2022 The Play Framework Contributors <https://github.com/playframework>, 2011-2021 Lightbend Inc. <https://www.lightbend.com> -->

# Pull Request Checklist

* [x] Have you read [How to write the perfect pull request](https://github.com/blog/1943-how-to-write-the-perfect-pull-request)?
* [x] Have you read through the [contributor guidelines](https://www.playframework.com/contributing)?
* [x] Have you referenced any issues you're fixing using [commit message keywords](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-using-keywords/)?
* [x] Have you added copyright headers to new files?
* [x] Have you checked that both Scala and Java APIs are updated?
* [x] Have you updated the documentation for both Scala and Java sections?
* [x] Have you added tests for any changed functionality?

# Helpful things

## Fixes

Fixes #9745 

## Purpose

This separates the Play Configuration class and related functionality into a new play-configuration subproject, which can be depended on independently of the full play framework.

## Background Context


This is taken from #9887 but has been rebased and squashed with conflicts resolved.

## References

- #9887
